column8: Job Creation and Mortgage Support Schemes: Discussion with Department of Social Protection
column10: The work is valid, there is no doubt about that, but is the Department satisfied with those take-up rates?

column8: Job Creation and Mortgage Support Schemes: Discussion with Department of Social Protection
column10: I am keen to conclude because we have been here a long time.

column8: Job Creation and Mortgage Support Schemes: Discussion with Department of Social Protection
column10: The Chairman asked a very good question about €20.

column8: Job Creation and Mortgage Support Schemes: Discussion with Department of Social Protection
column10: I believe that was answered, it had to do with financial constraints for the new schemes. Ideally, they should be standardised.

column8: Job Creation and Mortgage Support Schemes: Discussion with Department of Social Protection
column10: Okay.

column8: Job Creation and Mortgage Support Schemes: Discussion with Department of Social Protection
column10: Perhaps it would be would be better to pay everyone €30. That is one possibility. I am conscious that we have been here a long time. If anyone has anything to say, please keep it short.

column8: Job Creation and Mortgage Support Schemes: Discussion with Department of Social Protection
column10: Are there any plans to cap the time for which someone can get mortgage interest supplement? Ms Faughnan referred to it but we did not get an answer. Are there any definitive plans to cap the length of time that someone can avail of mortgage interest supplement?

column8: Job Creation and Mortgage Support Schemes: Discussion with Department of Social Protection
column10: Any such plans would have to be considered in a budgetary context.

column8: Job Creation and Mortgage Support Schemes: Discussion with Department of Social Protection
column10: Ms Faughnan referred to it in her opening address. Is there anything more definite?

column8: Job Creation and Mortgage Support Schemes: Discussion with Department of Social Protection
column10: Various review groups have come back to us, including the Cooney group report and the Keane group report. All have stated that mortgage interest supplement is not an ideal solution. It started as a short-term measure and it has effectively gone into the long term. In the case of mortgage-to-rent we are seeking to move people onto more long-term and sustainable solutions. That is the route we are going.

column8: Job Creation and Mortgage Support Schemes: Discussion with Department of Social Protection
column10: I asked some questions on JobBridge and the possibility of increasing it to €50. Are there any figures relating to what precisely would be involved in doing that? Does Ms Faughnan have any idea what the figures would be? Can Ms Faughnan elaborate on JobsPlus and the employers' feedback?

column8: Job Creation and Mortgage Support Schemes: Discussion with Department of Social Protection
column10: I have no wish to open up a series of new questions now. Perhaps we will just address that first question.

column8: Job Creation and Mortgage Support Schemes: Discussion with Department of Social Protection
column10: These are questions I have already asked.

column8: Job Creation and Mortgage Support Schemes: Discussion with Department of Social Protection
column10: I think they were answered. The issue is budgetary constraints.

column8: Job Creation and Mortgage Support Schemes: Discussion with Department of Social Protection
column10: I have clarified the matter with my colleague. Under many of the other initiatives the amount of work a person must do is 19.5 hours but under JobBridge it is 39 hours per week. The €50 came in there to reflect the increased hours.

column8: Job Creation and Mortgage Support Schemes: Discussion with Department of Social Protection
column10: I asked what the ballpark figures would be if that were to be increased.

column8: Job Creation and Mortgage Support Schemes: Discussion with Department of Social Protection
column10: I do not have those figures to hand but I can come back to the committee with an estimate. If we were to apply the €50 to all of our schemes which we are topping up currently at €20 per week it would have substantial budgetary costs.

column8: Job Creation and Mortgage Support Schemes: Discussion with Department of Social Protection
column10: What about an increase to the JobBridge allowance? Will the Department come back with what a €10, €20 or €30 increase in JobBridge would amount to and what the various costs would be? Will the Department provide that in tabular format?

column8: Job Creation and Mortgage Support Schemes: Discussion with Department of Social Protection
column10: Is the question solely about JobBridge?

column8: Job Creation and Mortgage Support Schemes: Discussion with Department of Social Protection
column10: I am asking about the other data as well. I asked a question about JobsPlus. What was the feedback from employers and why are none of them taking up JobsPlus?

column8: Job Creation and Mortgage Support Schemes: Discussion with Department of Social Protection
column10: JobsPlus kicked off during the summer months. A number of companies were not recruiting and summer is not always a good time to engage recruitment. Some of the employers that applied were not tax compliant and therefore their applications were turned down initially. It depends on where the employer is in terms of recruiting. The scheme started in the summer and the feedback suggested some employers were not recruiting at the time. However, we have over 2,000 employers who are now registered with us and we hope to see that improving over time.

column8: Job Creation and Mortgage Support Schemes: Discussion with Department of Social Protection
column10: I thank the deputation because they run a benevolent operation and their answers have been comprehensive. However, I have one question as a new Senator. I have only learned my way around the corridors after two years and I might not be here on Monday or whatever the story is. Is there anything the deputation has learned from us that they can take back or is this exercise relatively futile?

column8: Job Creation and Mortgage Support Schemes: Discussion with Department of Social Protection
column10: No, absolutely not. As soon as the transcript is issued to us we go through it line by line to feed back to the policy people responsible for the various schemes. The committee members and the Deputies in the House are the people on the ground and the information they provide to us is very useful.

column8: Job Creation and Mortgage Support Schemes: Discussion with Department of Social Protection
column10: Okay.

column8: Job Creation and Mortgage Support Schemes: Discussion with Department of Social Protection
column10: We will conclude on that note. I thank Ms Faughnan and her team. It has been an informative and helpful discussion.
